quanteda

join tokens function

For a set of tokens, given a set of token sequences, join the tokens matching the sequences.

joinTokens(x, ...)

# S3 method for tokenizedTexts
joinTokens(x, ...)

# S3 method for tokens
joinTokens(x, sequences, concatenator = "_",
  valuetype = c("glob", "fixed", "regex"), verbose = FALSE,
  case_insensitive = TRUE, ...)

Arguments

x
tokens or tokenizedTexts object
...
additional arguments passed to other methods
sequences
features to concatenate, a list of characters
concatenator
character used for joining tokens
valuetype
how to interpret sequences: fixed for words as is; "regex" for regular expressions; or "glob" for "glob"-style wildcard
verbose
display progress
case_insensitive
if TRUE, ignore case when matching

Examples


toks <- tokens(data_corpus_inaugural, removePunct = TRUE)
seqs <- list(c('foreign', 'polic*'), c('United', 'States'))
kwic(toks, 'fUnited_States', window = 1) # no exisit
#> [1] NA
kwic(toks, 'foreign_policy', window = 1) # no exisit
#> [1] NA
toks <- joinTokens(toks, seqs, "_", 'glob')
kwic(toks, 'United_States', window = 1)
#>                         contextPre       keyword    contextPost

#>  [1897-McKinley, 2814] dignified [ foreign_policy ] which     
#>  [1897-McKinley, 3022]       our [ foreign_policy ] throughout
kwic(toks, c('foreign', 'policy'), window = 1) # no longer exisit
#> [1] NA
kwic(toks, c('united', 'states'), window = 1) # no longer exisit
#> [1] NA
